International Conference on Microbial Communication for Young Scientists (MiCom)

Conference year: 2018

Disciplines: Microbial Communication

Total years: 7

Society name:

Society members:

Attendees: 160

Venues: Jena, Germany

Frequency: Annual

Sponsors: Universitat Jena, Balance of the Microverse, JSMC, MiCom2020

Is virtual?: None

Digital archives: None

Cost: $2000-$4000

Registration fee: $83 - $121

Carbon footprint: 240

Other carbon footprint: 48

Program: Yes the program was provided online on the conference website.

On-site maternity: None

Childcare: None

Caregiver grant: None

Career development: Yes ( 1. “Coping with pressure during PhD studies” by Dr. Hendrik Huthoff 2.“Statistical evaluation and analysis – How not to lie with your data” by Dr. Sascha Brunke 3.“Balancing scientific career and family life” by Prof. Dr. Miriam Agler-Rosenbaum and Dr. Matthew Agler 4. Iuliia Ferling, an elife ambassador, will give a workshop about good scientific practice and the reproducibility of research data – feel free to join.)

ECR promotion: It is an ECR conference

Travel awards: None

Code of conduct: None

Safety: None

Gender balance: None

Keynote speaker gender balance: 6 Men: 5 Women

Speaker gender balance: Not Applicable to this meeting.

Invited speakers gender balance: 33percent Female

Session chair gender balance: Not Applicable to this meeting.

Environment sustainability: None
